data.title: Editor removes auto inserted indentation when formatting on type
data.body:
- VSCode Version: alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. settings.json

``` json
{
    "editor.formatOnType": true,
    "typescript.tsserver.trace": "verbose",
    "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true,
    "editor.trimAutoWhitespace": true
}
```
1. TypeScript file

``` ts
function foo (params: string) {<cursor>}
```

Observe the blank between foo and ( which causes the formatter to kick in
3. Press enter

Observe: the newly inserted line has no indentation anymore.

The TS server trace looks like this:

``` json
Sending request: change (130). Response expected: no. Current queue length: 0
Arguments: {
    "file": "p:/mseng/VSCode/Playgrounds/bugs/TS6700/test.ts",
    "line": 1,
    "offset": 32,
    "endLine": 1,
    "endOffset": 32,
    "insertString": "\r\n\t\r\n"
}

Sending request: formatonkey (131). Response expected: yes. Current queue length: 0
Arguments: {
    "file": "p:/mseng/VSCode/Playgrounds/bugs/TS6700/test.ts",
    "line": 2,
    "offset": 2,
    "key": "\n"
}

Response received: formatonkey (131). Request took 5 ms. Success: true 
Result: [
    {
        "start": {
            "line": 1,
            "offset": 13
        },
        "end": {
            "line": 1,
            "offset": 14
        },
        "newText": ""
    }
]

Sending request: change (132). Response expected: no. Current queue length: 0
Arguments: {
    "file": "p:/mseng/VSCode/Playgrounds/bugs/TS6700/test.ts",
    "line": 2,
    "offset": 1,
    "endLine": 2,
    "endOffset": 2,
    "insertString": ""
}

Sending request: change (133). Response expected: no. Current queue length: 0
Arguments: {
    "file": "p:/mseng/VSCode/Playgrounds/bugs/TS6700/test.ts",
    "line": 1,
    "offset": 13,
    "endLine": 1,
    "endOffset": 14,
    "insertString": ""
}
```

The inseresting request is 132: this removes the indentation on line 2 although we haven't received any such edit from the TS server. The edit that we received from the TS server is applied via 133. So it looks like the editor is removing the indentation again although line two contains the cursor.

data.title: Have to delete twice to remove a multi-level folder containing JavaScript/TypeScript files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 10586.318

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder.
2. Create file `f/f/f.js`.
3. Delete top folder `f`.
   
   Then it prompts a message asking whether I would want to move it to recycle bin.
4. Click "Move to Recycle Bin".
   
   Explorer prompts "File Access Denied".
5. Click "Continue" (to gain administrator permission), and "OK" on UAC prompt.
   
   Code prompts "Failed to move `f` to the trash".
6. Delete it again or retry in anyway, success.

data.title: avoid 'integratedTerminal' and 'externalTerminal'. Rather use 'terminal'
data.body:
For #6654.
Right now the settings are called
"integratedTerminal.shell.linux": "/bin/bash"
"externalTerminal.windowsExec": "cmd",

If you look at other settings, we avoid camelcase in the first segment.
I'd suggest to group everything under terminal.

-> One setting that chooses which terminal type to use (e.g. when invoking 'Open in terminal').
'external', 'integrated'. IMO intergrated should be the default.
-> terminal.external.windowExec ...
-> terminal.integrated.shell

data.title: Could not get external grammar injections to work
allow for cascading peek
data.body:
- open a peek editor for reference search or previewing definitions
- inside that editor you cannot peek anymore
- we should have a way to invoke reference search/peek def in nested editors but without nesting peek inside peek

Hello,

data.body:
Is it possible to invoke vscode commands from task.json?
For example, invoke build command (or call extension) before launch debugger.
Thanks!

data.title: Failed to save 'test.txt': A system error occured (ESPIPE: invalid seek, write)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.0.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu Linux 16.04, Ubuntu Linux 15.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. connect to ftp using nautilus
2. open any text file with vs code from nautilus
3. add some changes to the file and save it

When you are trying to save the file you get the error saying: "Failed to save 'test.txt': A system error occured (ESPIPE: invalid seek, write)" and the file on the host gets blanked out.

![screenshot from 2016-05-25 09-59-29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13145179/15527975/653b793e-2261-11e6-933a-b6b311b09b0f.png)
![screenshot from 2016-05-25 10-08-18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13145179/15527976/653bf878-2261-11e6-9d89-2cc1d70b7676.png)

data.title: Find all references doesn't show default export
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Mac 10.11.5
  (latest as of May 24 2016)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create file `blah.ts` with a default export (e.g. `export default whatever = 123`)
2. In another file, `import someDefault from './blah'`.
3. If you right click on `someDefault` and select "Find all References", should it show the reference to the default export in `blah.ts`?  Right now, it doesn't.

data.title: Allow terminal to be relaunched without restarting VS Code when it exits with a non-zero exit code
data.body: #6683 fix means the integrated terminal cannot be restarted after the process errors without reloading the window.

data.title: Whitespace found via regex find is not highlighted throughout the document
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a large document with many lines and whitespace, such as a large code file.
2. Use find dialog with regex enabled to search for "\s".
3. Whitespace will be highlighted, but only on the first or second screen of text. As you scroll down the highlight will terminate.

data.title: Built-in terminal super jittery on vertical resize and even disappears sometimes
data.body:
OS: Windows

1) open the built-in terminal
2) run a command with a whole bunch or output such as 'npm list' or cat a file
3) grab the sash at the top of the terminal and resize
-> the terminal content flickers wildly
It seems the terminal window jumps back and forth between a minimal size and the actual size indicated by the sash.

Here is a [video of the issue](https://www.dropbox.com/s/67iw8agepi75q5h/jitter%20screenrecording.mov?dl=0).

data.title: Find with regex does not locate newlines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new file and add a few lines of text, separated by newlines
2. Open find dialog, enable regex, use regex "\n"
3. No matches will be found. Expected behavior would be to find the newlines. Also does not work with replace, so you cannot find and replace newlines.

data.title: Terminal scrolls content to the left without a reliable way of recovering
data.body:
OS: Windows

1) open the built-in terminal 
2) run command that produces a bunch of output such as 'npm list' or cat a file
3) try to scroll up to reveal text that was already scrolled out of sight
-> content is scrolled to the left (and then gets stuck)
-> there is no reliable way to get the terminal back into a 'normal' state; sometime Enter works, sometimes not

Here is a [screen recording](https://www.dropbox.com/s/y0x7m77ys8xne3v/scroll-issue.mov?dl=0).

data.title: Problem with ansi color codes with decoration part in debug console

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

In nodejs application, when i use console.log with ansi color codes.

Example, when i use `console.log(\x1b[36m%s\x1b[0m, 'working')`, it works correctly.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13858505/15523170/3295fa1c-2221-11e6-9213-3e8dba93ceaa.png)
But if i use `console.log(\x1b[36;1m%s\x1b[0m, 'working')`, it just prints out **[36;1mworking**.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13858505/15523159/11bc6a60-2221-11e6-9102-1f3f0600d9bd.png)

data.title: Can't toggle comment with key binding @ linux mint 17.3
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.1.1
Commit def9e32467ad6e4f48787d38caf190acbfee5880
Date 2016-05-13T13:38:00.094Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0
- OS Version: Linux Mint 17.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Plug in a Spanish keyboard (from Spain, pic below)
2. Try to use the key-bindings to comment (Ctrl + /)

Description:
I'm trying to select text and comment it, which is "Ctrl + /" and it's giving me an info message "For your current keyboard layout press " Ctrl + - ", this is annoying since it's not what I need (Ctrl + /), it doesn't work, and it's also wrong, since "my keyboard layout" works fine (as in / is /) in every application and IDE (tested in more than 20 IDEs and text editors in more than 10 different operating systems)

btw, "/" is the numpad slash in my keyboard, the one on top of the numbers, to the right, not the one on top of the number 7.

This is the exact keyboard
![image of DELL keyboard](http://www.stuartconnections.com/Products/Computers/Peripherals/Keyboards/Dell_J4612/DSC02421bigw.jpg)

key binding (same as default, but trying it anyways)

```
[
    { "key": "ctrl+/",          "command": "editor.action.blockComment",
                                     "when": "editorTextFocus" }
]
```

All I need is to set "comment block" or "comment line" to Ctrl + /, if I'm missing something, let me know.

data.title: Installing extensions from command line does not prompt for restart
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Code 
2. Install an extension from the command line (e.g. `--install-extension ms-vscode.csharp`)
3. Go back to Code

Does installing from the command line not require restarting Code?

data.title: When deleting on a new line cursor fails to move to last indentation
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.1
- OS Version: Linux 4.4.0-22-generic

When hitting delete, and the line is blank, cursor should move back to last tab-stop
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create some code blocks, with each line indented
2. Press enter
3. Press backspace

Issues: cursor moves back only single character, the expected behavior is to move back to previous indentation.

data.title: Bracket auto-completion doesn't recognize an existing closing bracket

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open launch.json or create one
2. Delete the opening bracket { under configurations
3. Re-type the opening bracket

Auto-complete adds in a closing bracket when the closing bracket at the end of the config is showing an error. It would make sense that bracket auto-complete would know that there is an open bracket and to not add the closing bracket at the top.

data.title: [themes] does not work if publisher name starts with a number
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: OSX10.11.4, Windows10

I made and publish a theme, but it did not work.
https://github.com/74th/vscode-naturalcontrast-with-hc

![screen shot 2016-05-25 at 07 08 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1060011/15521650/d071a18e-2247-11e6-9831-e1bdd99b8b6a.png)

But I changed publisher name "74th" -> "j74th" in package.json, it works.

```
    "publisher": "74th",
```

```
    "publisher": "j74th",
```

![screen shot 2016-05-25 at 07 09 38](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1060011/15521709/217bb560-2248-11e6-9e6a-154231d1a58f.png)

data.title: Break points are hit or miss on node 6.2.0 on Windows
data.body:
While testing #6659.

If I simply follow the steps, the break point in index.js line 6 is never hit. However, if I insert a debugger statement everything is fine. 

The NTVS team (@mjbvz and @mousetrap) are seeing the same / a similar issue.

data.title: Investigate term.js alternatives
data.body:
term.js is showing its limitations, the two options are to either fork it ourselves to suit our use case, or go with one of its more prominent forks:
- Community fork, converted to TypeScript https://github.com/sedwards2009/extraterm
- Built for commercial product https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js
- https://github.com/IonicaBizau/web-term
- https://github.com/shockone/black-screen

sedwards2009/extraterm looks very active https://github.com/sedwards2009/extraterm/graphs/contributors

Here are some of the problems that have sparked this issue:
- Integrated terminal cursor is in the wrong position after resize #6784
- Autoscrolling does not work in integrated terminal #6755
- selection problem in integrated terminal #6750
- Integrated terminal wraps incorrectly #6740
- Using cls in integrated terminal sometimes freezes it #6735
- The integrated terminal appears to be bottom-aligned, which makes it wobbly #6729
- Terminal: I am not getting scrollbars for scrolling? #6602

data.title: Support to navigate between debug views using keyboard shortcuts

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
We should expose commands to navigate between the different viewlets of the debugger (variables, watch, call stack, exceptions/breakpoints).

Having that I could setup the keybindings and thus debug more efficiently.

data.title: Support for arrow-up and arrow-down in debugger call stack view
data.body: Currently I have to use the mouse to switch between frames on the call stack. I'd like to use the arrow-up and down keys. When doing so, the editor should switch to show the source of the call stack frame but not grab the keyboard focus. When I press enter on the currently selected call stack frame, the editor should grab focus (as it is right now).

data.title: Should/can we move the electron executable?
data.body: I've seen a lot of people have legacy/manual symlinks that point at code, not bin/code. Should we move `code` to another directory so they break and it's more clear that bin/code is the right one?

data.title: VSCode become unresponsive when provided wrong name for terminal in integratedTerminal setting.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Latest alpha
- OS Version: WIndows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Launch VSCode and update setting in settings.json to some random text or just "powershell" (no extension) or "cms"
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15517237/9d6f3df6-21ab-11e6-97a3-c8c70084ba4f.png)
2. Reload window to get reflection of the new setting.
3. Now try to launch terminal window with CTRL+` and verify app behavior.

Actual:
1. Most of the time Application is not responsive.
2. Restart app didn't solve the issue.
3. user is not able to modify settings as user not able to set mouse point on editor window.
4. In taskmanager you see VSCode is consuming lots of memory 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15517426/82e1c3a4-21ac-11e6-8beb-4d56d47e81f1.png)

 **I could see Error: write EPIPE in developer tool.**

index.html?config={"pathArguments"%3A[]%2C"programStart"%3A0%2C"enablePerformance"%3Afalse%2C"verbo…:31 Error: write EPIPE
    at exports._errnoException (util.js:890:11)
    at ChildProcess.target._send (internal/child_process.js:634:20)
    at ChildProcess.target.send (internal/child_process.js:521:19)
    at Terminal.<anonymous> (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Alpha/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/parts/terminal/electron-browser/terminalPanel.js:4:2809)
    at Terminal.EventEmitter.emit (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Alpha\resources\app\node_modules\term.js\src\term.js:109:12)
    at Terminal.handler (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Alpha\resources\app\node_modules\term.js\src\term.js:3493:8)
    at Terminal.keyDown (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Alpha\resources\app\node_modules\term.js\src\term.js:3196:8)
    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Alpha\resources\app\node_modules\term.js\src\term.js:594:29)
